intro: Rosa communis var. loretiana, commonly known as the Loretana rose, is a cultivar of the common rose that exhibits distinctive botanical features. It is characterized by its deep pink to red blooms, which are typically fragrant and borne on sturdy stems. The plant has glossy, dark green foliage that provides a striking contrast to its vibrant flowers. It is a deciduous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often used in garden landscapes for its beauty and fragrance.
